Posts.Content: Congratulations on your successful chemo! It's really encouraging to those of us still undergoing treatment. We hope your numbers stay low and scans show major improvements. We'll be watching for an update. Mary
Posts.Signature: Spouse DX 2/16 PSA 8/14 1.4 PSA 12/15 13.1 PSA 1/16 31.8 2/11/16 Biopsy 12/12 Gleason 10 2/23/16 CT & MRI Pelvic Nodes Enlarged 2/29/16 Casodex 3/10/16 Lupron 3/22 - 5/20/16 43 IMRT sessions 5/25/16 PSA 3.6 5/31/16 CT & MRI bone mets 6/6/16 PSA 7.4 6/8/16 Start Taxotere PSA 9 6/22/16 PSA 3.2 7/14/16 PSA 5.5 7/20/16 3rd Taxotere PSA 11.1 8/3/16 PSA 6.5 8/9/16 PSA 14.9 8/17/16 PSA 28 CT & MRI more mets 9/14/16 Start Jevtana PSA 75
Posts.Title: Renewed hope for Stage 4 Metastatic Pca

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear about your dad. My husband had his first chemo treatment two weeks ago. He has had very few side effects from the chemo or the radiation and hormone therapy he's had in the past couple months. He's just starting to lose some hair and had a kind of blotchy rash on his arm (probably from the sun), but he didn't even have the crash days that people complain of. Fingers crossed that this continues during future cycles. They seem to have manipulated the Taxotere to make it more tolerable. I've read that chemo can help with the pain from bone mets too if that's an issue. Good luck to you and your dad.
